title: Metacognition-Based Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Targets science majors aiming to improve complex problem-solving abilities. Requires designing a self-directed learning structure feasible in mobile environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze complex mathematical problems using metacognitive strategies (self-questioning, think-aloud, concept mapping).
Learners can reduce errors by over 20% by applying cognitive regulation skills (planning-monitoring-evaluating) during problem-solving processes.
Learners can structure and explain problem-solving thinking processes by creating metacognitive journals using digital tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
